intro: Quamoclit lutea, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its yellow-orange petals are prominent, and it produces small, blue berries in the fall. Quamoclit lutea is valued for its ornamental beauty and ecological importance to pollinators.
